Comment: ***From Business Insider's Grace Eliza Goodwin and John L. Dorman***:      [Elon Musk](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk) may be winding down his work with the Department of Government Efficiency, but that doesn't mean the cost-cutting task force will be ending any time soon.  Musk, the chief executive of both Tesla and SpaceX, announced on Tuesday that he'd be reducing his presence at the [White House DOGE office](https://www.businessinsider.com/doge-department-of-government-efficiency) down to one or two days a week so he can focus more of his time on Tesla — which during the first quarter of 2025 saw its [earnings](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-earnings-call-report-tsla-stock-live-updates-2025-4) plunge 71% year over year.  In the three months since [President Donald Trump](https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump) established the initiative, unofficially led by Musk, it has worked quickly to reduce government spending and gut the federal workforce.  In its attempt to fulfill its stated purpose of rooting out fraud, waste, and abuse, DOGE has targeted nearly every federal agency.  But DOGE's work is far from over, and in some ways, it's still just getting started.  [Read more](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-stepping-back-doge-whats-next-2025-4?utm_source=reddit&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=insider-politics-sub-post).
Author: thisisinsider
